page.title: 04Farming around Buckden
page.content: The main type of farming is the cultivation of arable crops. Most of the land within the D-block is farmed by Mr. Mailer of Park Farm. Fifteen years ago oil seed rape was hardly grown at all,potatoes and sugar beet grew instead. The clay content in the local soil made heavy work for these root crops and so the farmers swopped to the new crop which is now very popular. Grain crops and peas are also grown. A field manager advises Mr. Mailer about his crop. For instance when to spray against the weevil,the crops worst pest which makes the pod rotten. The harvested crop is stored on the farm before being sold to a local merchant. He also keeps a beef herd, which is uncommon in the area as is the dairy herd kept by a neighbouring farmer.
